        Parameters:

        spell - Spell cast
        cell - Cell targeted
        Returns:

      • executeCommand

        public static java.lang.String executeCommand(java.lang.String s,
                                              java.util.ArrayList<Player> entities)
        Executes any command that needs some players specified. Currently the only command available is the "init entities" command.
        Parameters:
        s - command String
        Commands are written as follows : bot_instance;action_number;bot_part;type_of_message;command;parameters
        Bot instance : Which bot is currently asking/returning the command/return. The default is 0.
        Action number : Number corresponding to the action being done right now. It increases as the bot executes commands.
        Bot part : 'f' for this bot (fight bot). Other letters can be found as 'm' for model and 'i' for interface.
        Type of message : "cmd" if the message is a command, "rtn" if the message is a return.

        Command : Type of command to the specified bot. Commands accepted :
        s - Spawns the entities passed as parameters at the locations specified, with given ID and team.
        Parameters : the parameters passed as a String. These vary upon the type of the command.

        -- Examples --

        Init entities
        0;403;f;cmd;s;[[0,1,11,12],[1,0,6,12]]
        Bot 0, command 403, fight bot receiving a command to start init two entities. Entity 0 in team 1 at position 11,12 and entity 1 in team 0 at position 6,12.
        [player_ID, team_ID, posX, posY]

        entities -
        Returns:
        the return String
        The return String is written according to the command String. It returns the same bot instance, action number and bot part.
        The type of message is switched to "rtn" as it is the return of the command. There is no command and the parameter returned is either 'true' or 'false' according to the success of the command.

      • executeCommand

        public static java.lang.String executeCommand(java.lang.String s)
        Executes any command that can be displayed in a String. Other commands are passed through other "executeCommand" methods that take different parameters.
        Parameters:
        s - command String
        Commands are written as follows : bot_instance;action_number;bot_part;type_of_message;command;parameters
        Bot instance : Which bot is currently asking/returning the command/return. The default is 0.
        Action number : Number corresponding to the action being done right now. It increases as the bot executes commands.
        Bot part : 'f' for this bot (fight bot). Other letters can be found as 'm' for model and 'i' for interface.
        Type of message : "cmd" if the message is a command, "rtn" if the message is a return.

        Command : Type of command to the specified bot. Commands accepted :
        startFight - Starts the fight according to the map passed as a parameter
        m - Moves the entity of which the ID is passed as a parameter, with the new position
        p - Passes the turn of the entity corresponding to the ID passed
        c - Casts a spell. Parameters are the caster's ID, the spell location, the spell ID, the spell name, the damage, and if it was a critical hit
        g - 'get' command, requests the best possible move for the entity corresponding to the ID passed
        Parameters : the parameters passed as a String. These vary upon the type of the command.

        -- Examples --

        Start a fight
        0;403;f;cmd;startfight;[84675595]
        Bot 0, command 403, fight bot receiving a command to start a fight on map 84675595.
        [map_ID]

        Move entity
        0;405;f;cmd;m;[0,11,12]
        Bot 0, command 405, fight bot receiving a command to move entity 0 to position 11,12
        [entity_ID, posX, posY]

        Pass turn
        0;406;f;cmd;p;[0]
        Bot 0, command 406, fight bot receiving a command to pass turn of entity 0
        [entity_ID]

        Cast spell
        0;408;f;cmd;c;[0,9,12,161,'Magic arrow',150,False]
        Bot 0, command 408, fight bot receiving a command to cast spell 'Magic arrow', ID:161. The caster is the entity 0 and the spell is cast at the position 9,12. It does 150 damage and is not a critical hit.
        [entity_ID, posX, posY, spellID, spellName, damage, crit]

        Returns:
        the return String
        The return String is written according to the command String. It returns the same bot instance, action number and bot part.
        The type of message is switched to "rtn" as it is the return of the command. There is no command and the parameter returned is either 'true' or 'false' according to the success of the command.
